qas.question: Which Duchamp presentation was displayed in the 1912 Salon des Independants?
Was Duchamp's work considered controversial when displayed in 1912?
What were one of  Metzingers two showings in 1912's Salon des Independants?

answers.text: La Femme au Cheval (Woman with a horse) 1911-1912

qas.question: Which Duchamp presentation was displayed in the 1913 Salon des Independants?
What painting of Duchamp's was not controversial?
What were one of Metzingers two showings in 1913's Salon des Independants?
Where was Woman with a Door displayed?

plausible_answers.text: Musée d'art moderne de la Ville de Paris

qas.question: Where was La Ville de Rome featured?

context: The subsequent 1912 Salon des Indépendants was marked by the presentation of Marcel Duchamp's <a0_0><b3_0><b4_0>Nude Descending a Staircase, No. 2<a0_0/>,<b4_0/><b3_0/> which itself <a1_0>caused a scandal<a1_0/>, even amongst the Cubists. It was in fact rejected by the hanging committee, which included his brothers and other Cubists. Although the work was shown in the Salon de la Section d'Or in October 1912 and the 1913 Armory Show in New York, Duchamp never forgave his brothers and former colleagues for censoring his work. Juan Gris, a new addition to the Salon scene, exhibited his Portrait of Picasso (Art Institute of Chicago), while Metzinger's two showings included <a2_0><b5_0><b6_0>La Femme au Cheval<b6_0/><b5_0/> (Woman with a horse) 1911-1912<a2_0/> (National Gallery of Denmark). Delaunay's monumental La Ville de Paris (<b7_0>Musée d'art moderne de la Ville de Paris<b7_0/>) and Léger's La Noce, The Wedding (Musée National d'Art Moderne, Paris) were also exhibited.
